summary: This document is an email chain from August 27, 2020, regarding the drafting and issuance of subpoenas for four individuals and one of Jeffrey Epstein's former assistants in connection with the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The correspondence involves Assistant U.S. Attorneys, an FBI contractor, and law enforcement personnel coordinating the legal process.

persons.name: Paul
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who should receive PDF copies of the drafted subpoenas via email.

persons.name: Mandy
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who should receive PDF copies of the drafted subpoenas via email.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Requested that a subpoena be issued for one of Jeffrey Epstein's former assistants.

persons.name: Young, Amanda N.
persons.context: Listed as a recipient in the email chain regarding the subpoena requests.

persons.name: Byrne, Paul
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (Cc) in the email chain regarding the subpoena requests.

connections.description: Maurene requested a subpoena for one of Jeffrey Epstein's former assistants as part of the investigation.

events.title: Subpoena drafting for Maxwell case
events.description: Email correspondence coordinating the drafting and issuance of subpoenas for four individuals and one of Epstein's former assistants in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Subpoenas were being drafted for four individuals and one of Jeffrey Epstein's former assistants in August 2020 for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The request for the subpoena for Epstein's ex-assistant came from an individual named Maurene, who appears to be part of law enforcement.
The correspondence shows coordination between Assistant U.S. Attorneys, an FBI contractor, and FBI/NYPD task force members in the Southern District of New York.
